title: Research Data Management (RDM) plans
text: Following on yesterday‚Äôs FAIR session

title: Research Data Management (RDM) plans
text:
Recap: First Simple FAIR Checklist


Planning Phase (Findable + Reusable)

Repository identified
License selected (CC0/CC-BY)
File naming conventions documented
Folder structure planned
Community standards identified

Active Research (Interoperable + Accessible)

README maintained with context
Data dictionary created
Metadata captured systematically
Open formats used when possible
Raw data preserved separately


Pre-Publication (All FAIR principles)

Documentation complete and clear
Formats standardized for sharing
Data uploaded to repository
Metadata finalized
Access permissions set

Publication (Findable + Accessible)

DOI assigned and verified
ORCID profile updated
Data Availability Statement (DAS) written
All links functional

title: Research Data Management (RDM) plans
section: What is a Data Management plan?
text:
What is a Data Management plan?

Document that outlines how data will be handled during and after a research project
Structures¬†Data Management¬†in a way that it is¬†easier to¬†keep track of it

title: Research Data Management (RDM) plans
text:
Components of a DMP


Research data life cycle by J√ºrgen Rohrwild

title: Research Data Management (RDM) plans
text:
What belongs in your DMP?




üõ†Ô∏è Task (~5 minutes)


Imagine you are about to start a new research project. For that you will create a Data Management plan that should cover all data related aspects of your project. In small groups, brainstorm what should be included in this plan - taking into account the specifics of your research discipline.





Research data life cycle by J√ºrgen Rohrwild

title: Research Data Management (RDM) plans
text:
Why is a DMP helpful?



Clarifies central aspects of RDM ‚Üí structure for and optimization of Data Management
Support for your own good scientific work ‚Üí ensures that your data is complete, accurate, trustworthy and FAIR
Data guidelines for the entire course of the project ‚Üí ‚Äúliving document‚Äú





AI-generated, created with GPT-5

title: Research Data Management (RDM) plans
text:
Room for Improvement?




üõ†Ô∏è Task (~5 minutes)


DFG Checklist, section 1: Data description  How does your project generate new data? Is existing data reused? Which data types (in terms of data formats like image data, text data or measurement data) arise in your project and in what way are they further processed? To what extent do these arise or what is the anticipated data volume?
Given answer in a DMP: ‚ÄúThe sample data is recorded and organized with specific software. One to three GB of data is generated.‚Äù
Now it is your turn: Is there anything to improve? Is there anything missing in this answer?

title: Research Data Management (RDM) plans
text:
Data Management plan tools

Software to create Data Management plans
Simplified workflow, allows collaborative work
Project management tool for handling research data
No repository / storage solution: You cannot upload and store your data in a DMP tool


Example: RDMO

title: Research Data Management (RDM) plans
text:
Research Data Management Organiser (RDMO)

Online-Tool to create DMPs (Open Source)
DMPs are stored on local servers (by the LMU)


Features:

Use existing DMP templates (called questionnaires)
Collaborative Work: Rights- and role management
Import and export DMPs ‚Üí polished, funder-ready DMP
Snapshots: Capture different versions of your DMP

title: Research Data Management (RDM) plans
text:
Let‚Äôs explore RDMO together



https://rdmo.ub.lmu.de/

title: Research Data Management (RDM) plans
text:
Now, it‚Äôs your turn‚Ä¶



üõ†Ô∏è Task (~20 minutes)


Use RDMO to start creating a Data Management plan ‚Äî either for your own research project or for a fictional project you design together in your group.

Log in to RDMO: rdmo.ub.lmu.de
Create a new project using the European Research Council (ERC) catalog.
Work through the questions, thinking carefully about:

What types of data you will collect or generate?
Which file formats will be used?
How you will organize and name files?
What metadata and identifiers will you use?
Where to publish your data under which conditions?

title: Research Data Management (RDM) plans
text:
Planning is everything
‚Ä¶ is it?

Try not to get lost in the details.
Use the DMP as a management tool to keep an overview of your tasks.
Update your DMP as you go - it‚Äôs an evolving process and doesn‚Äôt need to include all details from the start.
Take advantage of counseling services.
